results.title: Discipline
results.brief_description: Parents, teachers and psychologists look at this age-old problem. They discuss how to discipline effectively, whether corporal punishment works, problems faced by today’s teachers, negotiating with a child and how discipline can become abuse.

results.title: Disability awareness
results.creator_credit: Louise Welsh Schrank and Stage Fright Geneva, Il
results.brief_description: When you encounter someone who is physically or mentally handicapped how do you react? Pity? Discomfort? Either reaction will influence your ability to communicate. This program is essentially about improving communication and relationships with the disabled. Good guidance (“enabling tips”) is given by a deaf woman, a boy whose wheelchair is an extension of his body, and a girl blind from birth. The benefits of integration (mainstreaming) and ‘coaching’ are explored as we learn about the school lives of a child with Down’s Syndrome, a boy with cerebral palsy and the blind girl. The power and importance of non-judgemental language is also covered.

results.title: Dinosaur junction series
results.brief_description: This video contains three short episodes of ‘Dinosaur Junction’ which uses animated dinosaurs to illustrate in a fun way how children can learn to cope with problems they face such as peer pressure and fighting. ‘Doin’ it you way’ looks at decision making and peer pressure; ‘The fight’ looks at controlling your temper and dealing with anger; ‘What’s in a name’ looks at self esteem and fitting in. Suitable for Primary level students.

results.title: Dinosaur
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton and Will Vinton Productions
results.brief_description: Clay animated figures and simple chalk line drawings are transformed into awe-inspiring prehistoric animals in this interpretation of our earth as it existed long before man. A fastpaced motivating introduction to dinosaurs and their prehistoric world, suitable for children of all ages.

results.title: Dime
results.creator_credit: Larry Klingman and Little Red Filmhouse
results.brief_description: Follows the circulation of a dime from the mint through many changes of hands. Explores the various functions of money from its use as a means of exchange for goods and services to coin collecting. Concludes as a young boy tries to retrieve the coin from a storm drain and put it back into circulation.

results.title: Dilemma
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Computer Creations USA and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A fully digitised computer-animated film which shows the progress of civilisation throughout the ages, but poses the question whether man will use his inventive abilities for destruction or as the key to progressive creation.

results.title: Digestion: Muscular and mechanical movement
results.creator_credit: Beryl Denman Lacey, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Deals with the muscular processes involved in the digestion of food. The film demonstrates mechanical and muscular processes of mastication and swallowing; peristalsis in the oesophagus, small intestine, and colour segmentation in the small intestine; contraction waves in the cardiac and pyloric regions of the stomach; absorption of food into the blood from the small intestine, and of water and salts from the colon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beryl Denman Lacey, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional

results.title: Digestion. Pt. 2: chemical changes
results.creator_credit: Beryl Denman Lacey and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: An account of the chief changes involved in the chemical breakdown of the main types of foodstuffs during digestion. Shows the secretion of saliva and its action on cooked starch; the gastric glands; secretion of intestinal bile and pancreatic juice and their effect on proteins, carbohydrates and fats; the absorption of nutriment through the villi and lacteals into the blood and its subsequent circulation through the body.
